From my brief scan of the JUnit4.1 docs, one could create
a custom Runner u=
sing the @RunWith annotation, correct?

I would like to add the following c=
apabilities:

 i) parameterize the fixture @BeforeClass/@AfterClass methods=
:

    @BeforeClass
    public static void setupFixtures(Properties p) {
  =
     ...
    }
    The properties would be provided by searching the classp=
ath
    for the resource 'x.y.z.foo.properties' where 'x.y.z' is
    the pa=
ckage of the current testclass and 'foo' is the
    all-lowercase-name of t=
he testclass. The main motivation is
    testing with databases - the vario=
us login parameters are
    always changing with new versions of databases =
we must test
    against (not just Oracle!).

 ii) a new runtime Assert cal=
led 'ignore("some msg")' to parallel
    the design-time @Ignore annotation=
. The motivation is (again!)
    testing with databases - we have a numerou=
s tests that run
    against many versions of databases, but each version h=
as their
    own idiosyncratic capabilities - e.g. each vendor handles
    =
stored-procedures a little different. A test suite may have
    hundreds of=
 tests that pass all db-platforms, but some that only
    pass for known co=
nfigurations. At runtime the test can
    interrogate the db-fixture and de=
cide to not fail the testcase
    but to ignore it.

Any reason the above b=
ehaviour could not be implemented in a
custom Runner?
